alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:29PM MDT until June 16 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following counties, Sandoval and Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in arroyos, washes, low-lying areas and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Santa Fe, La Cienega, La Bajada and Pena Blanca. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 265 and 276.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive through flooded areas. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
